meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm back with another groovy review that's sure to make you wanna rock around the clock! This time, I've got my eyes on "Capes" - a superhero-flavored turn-based tactical combat game that's been getting all sorts of rave reviews. So, let's dive in and see if this caped crusader is worth your gaming time!

First off, IGN says Capes is "clever and challenging," which is music to my ears. I mean, who doesn't love a good challenge? And it seems like the game delivers on that front, with plenty of opportunities to get creative with your team's powers and ultimate abilities. Stealth missions might be a bit hit-or-miss, but hey, even the best heroes have off days, right?

Worth Playing chimes in, saying Capes is just plain fun - and I'm inclined to agree! If you're an XCOM fan looking for more of that same strategic goodness, with maybe a few more powers at your disposal, Capes has got you covered. And even though the plot might be a bit by-the-numbers and the characters somewhat thin, it's hard not to get invested in the next exciting stage or boss fight.

Vandal, on the other hand, seems a bit more...well, let's just say they're keeping their cards close to their chest . Maybe they're just trying to keep the good stuff for themselves - we'll have to wait and see what they have to say!

Meanwhile, Hardcore Gamer is all about the positives. They rave about Capes' vibrant visuals, intricate gameplay mechanics, and thought-provoking narrative - which has me intrigued! I mean, who doesn't love a good story that makes you think? And even with some minor audio-visual sync issues and balance quirks in the combat system, they say the overall experience is still overwhelmingly positive.

PC Gamer agrees, saying Capes is one of the best turn-based strategy games out there. An awkward story might not be its strongest suit, but hey, that's just a small blemish on an otherwise fantastic game.

GameStar, however, seems to have had a slightly more...mixed experience . Maybe they're just trying to keep us all in suspense - we'll have to see what they have to say!

Finally, The Games Machine gives Capes a solid thumbs-up, saying it's the perfect game for fans of XCOM. They praise its complexity, colorfulness, and ability to challenge even the most seasoned gamers.

So, there you have it - my take on Capes! If you're looking for a fun, challenging, and thought-provoking gaming experience with plenty of opportunities to get creative, then this caped crusader is definitely worth checking out. Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got some superhero-ing to attend to...
